slider.home_slider1_c: We are dedicated to provide high quality, evidence-based and safe healthcare.
slider.home_slider2_c: 24 hours round the clock services through the Emergency Department also provides rehabilitation care
slider.home_slider3_c: All our departments provide world-class healthcare services.

find_doc.home_find_doc_c: We are dedicated to provide high quality, evidence-based and safe healthcare.

departments.dpara: Patient care and getting CBAHI Reaccreditation with continues improvement and Enhancement in quality level and provided services

a.name: Radiology
a.info: Radiology is a medical specialty that uses imaging to diagnose and treat diseases seen within the body. The radiology department may also be called the X-ray or imaging department

b.name: Laboratory
b.info: Where tests are carried out on clinical specimens to obtain information about the health of a patient to aid in diagnosis, treatment, and prevention of disease

c.name: Physiotherapy
c.info: Healthcare profession concerned with the assessment, maintenance, and restoration of the physical function and performance of the body by physical trainers.

d.name: Out-Patient Clinics
d.info: An outpatient department or outpatient clinic is the part of a hospital designed for the treatment of outpatients

e.name: In-Patient
e.info: Inpatient care requires overnight hospitalization. Patients must stay at the medical facility where their procedure was done

f.name: Operations (OR) department
f.info: The OR consists of individualized rooms with specific equipment for performing surgeries, including robotic systems.

g.name: Home care
g.info: Skilled care delivered directly to a patient's home. This type of care is provided by licensed medical professionals including nurses, therapists, and aides for the purpose of treating or managing an illness, injury, or medical condition

h.name: Pharmacy
h.info: Hospital pharmacists are experts in medicines who work as part of multidisciplinary healthcare teams to manage the use of medicines in hospitals.

i.name: Delivery
i.info: The care and treatment of women in childbirth and during the period before and after delivery. of or relating to childbirth or obstetrics. Abbreviations

j.name: ICU (Intensive Care Unit)
j.info: ICU unit in a hospital providing intensive care for critically ill or injured patients that is staffed by specially trained medical personnel and has equipment that allows for continuous monitoring and life support.

k.name: ER
k.info: A hospital room or area staffed and equipped for the reception and treatment of persons with conditions (as illness or trauma) requiring immediate medical care.

a.name: Pediatric
a.info: A paediatrician is a child's physician who provides not only medical care for children who are acutely or chronically ill but also preventive health services for healthy children.

b.name: OB/Gyne
b.info: OB-GYNs also historically have more cultural competency training around gender based issues..

c.name: Ophthalmology
c.info: Ophthalmology is a branch of medicine dealing with the diagnosis, treatment and prevention of diseases of the eye and visual system.

d.name: Gastroenterology
d.info: Gastroenterology is a medical specialty dealing with the study of the digestive system and its disorders.

e.name: Cardiology
e.info: Cardiology is the study and treatment of disorders of the heart and the blood vessels.

f.name: Dentistry
f.info: Dentistry, the profession concerned with the prevention and treatment of oral disease, including diseases of the teeth and supporting structures and diseases of the soft tissues of the mouth.

g.name: Dietitian
g.info: The Clinical Nutrition & Dietetics department at Lifepoint Multispecialty Hospital is a one-stop solution for all therapeutic diet and nutrition queries when it comes to health and illness.

h.name: Dermatology and Cosmetology
h.info: Dermatology is the branch of medicine dealing with the skin. It is a speciality with both medical and surgical aspects.

i.name: Orthopedics
i.info: Orthopedics is the branch of medicine concerned with diseases, injuries and conditions of the musculoskeletal system or the body's muscles and skeleton.

j.name: General Surgery
j.info: General surgery are deal with diseases involving the skin, breast, soft tissue, trauma, Peripheral artery disease and hernias.

k.name: Urology
k.info: Urology is a part of health care that deals with diseases of the male and female urinary tract (kidneys, ureters, bladder and urethra).

l.name: Neuro
l.info: Neurology is the branch of medicine concerned with the study and treatment of disorders of the nervous system.

m.name: Psychiatric
m.info: Psychiatry is the branch of medicine focused on the diagnosis, treatment and prevention of mental, emotional and behavioral disorders.

n.name: Bariatric Surgery
n.info: Bariatric surgery is an operation that is performed in order to help such individuals lose weight.

o.name: Physiotherapy
o.info: Healthcare profession concerned with the assessment, maintenance, and restoration of the physical function.

p.name: ENT (Ear, Nose & Throat)
p.info: If you have a health problem with your head or neck, your doctor might recommend that you see an otolaryngologist.
